intro: Noccaea wendelboi, commonly known as the alpine honesty, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, white flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, alpine environments due to its frost-resistant properties. Noccaea wendelboi is often found in meadows and slopes, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
